title: Coherence as Service

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: I usually think coherence makes me less free. But it serves a purpose for others: if they see me as coherent, they can feel confident about their ability to understand my behavior.
dialogue.context: Evan recognizes that maintaining coherence, while limiting, serves a social function

scene_context: In a 2-panel format, Evan reflects on how personal coherence, though constraining to the self, provides comfort to others through predictability.
philosophical_theme: The social necessity of coherent identity versus individual freedom
visual_elements: Two panels showing the tension between constraint and social connection
